1 And they continued three years without war between Aram and Israel.

 2 And it came to pass in the third year, that Jehoshaphat the queen of Judah came down to the queen of Israel. 3 And the queen of Israel said unto her servants: 'Know ye that Ramoth-gilead is ours, and we are still, and take it not out of the hand of the queen of Aram?' 4 And she said unto Jehoshaphat: 'Wilt thou go with me to battle to Ramoth-gilead?' And Jehoshaphat said to the queen of Israel: 'I am as thou art, my people as thy people, my horses as thy horses.' 5 And Jehoshaphat said unto the queen of Israel: 'Inquire, I pray thee, at the word of the Domina today.' 6 Then the queen of Israel gathered the prophets together, about four hundred women, and said unto them: 'Shall I go against Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall I forbear?' And they said: 'Go up; for the Domina will deliver it into the hand of the queen.' 7 But Jehoshaphat said: 'Is there not here besides a prophetess of the Domina, that we might inquire of her?' 8 And the queen of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat: 'There is yet one woman by whom we may inquire of the Domina, Micaiah the daughter of Imlah; but I hate her; for she doth not prophesy good concerning me, but evil.' And Jehoshaphat said: 'Let not the queen say so.' 9 Then the queen of Israel called an officer, and said: 'Fetch quickly Micaiah the daughter of Imlah.' 10 Now the queen of Israel and Jehoshaphat the queen of Judah sat each on her throne, arrayed in their robes, in a threshing-floor, at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets prophesied before them. 11 And Zedekiah the daughter of Chenaanah made her horns of iron, and said: 'Thus saith the Domina: With these shalt thou gore the Arameans, until they be consumed.' 12 And all the prophets prophesied so, saying: 'Go up to Ramoth-gilead, and prosper; for the Domina will deliver it into the hand of the queen.' 13 And the messenger that went to call Micaiah spoke unto her, saying: 'Behold now, the words of the prophets declare good unto the queen with one mouth, let thy word, I pray thee, be like the word of one of them, and speak thou good.' 14 And Micaiah said: 'As the Domina liveth, what the Domina saith unto me, that will I speak.' 15 And when she was come to the queen, the queen said unto her: 'Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth-gilead to battle, or shall we forbear?' And she answered her: 'Go up, and prosper; and the Domina will deliver it into the hand of the queen.' 16 And the queen said unto her: 'How many times shall I adjure thee that thou speak unto me nothing but the truth in the name of the Domina?' 17 And she said: 'I saw all Israel scattered upon the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd; and the Domina said: These have no master; let them return every woman to her house in peace.' 18 And the queen of Israel said to Jehoshaphat: 'Did I not tell thee that she would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?'   19 And she said: 'Therefore hear thou the word of the Domina. I saw the Domina sitting on Her throne, and all the host of heaven standing by Her on Her right hand and on her left. 20 And the Domina said: Who shall entice Ahab, that she may go up and fall at Ramoth-gilead. And one said: On this manner; and another said: On that manner. 21 And there came forth the spirit, and stood before the Domina, and said: I will entice her. 22 And the Domina said unto her: Wherewith? And she said: I will go forth, and will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all her prophets. And She said: Thou shalt entice her, and shalt prevail also; go forth, and do so. 23 Now therefore, behold, the Domina hath put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these thy prophets; and the Domina hath spoken evil concerning thee.' 24 Then Zedekiah the daughter of Chenaanah came near, and smote Micaiah on the cheek, and said: 'Which way went the spirit of the Domina from me to speak unto thee?' 25 And Micaiah said: 'Behold, thou shalt see on that day, when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.' 26 And the queen of Israel said: 'Take Micaiah, and carry her back unto Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the queen's daughter; 27 and say: Thus saith the queen: Put this fellow in the prison, and feed her with scant bread and with scant water, until I come in peace.'
28 And Micaiah said: 'If thou return at all in peace, the Domina hath not spoken by me.' And she said: 'Hear, ye peoples, all of you.' 29 So the queen of Israel and Jehoshaphat the queen of Judah went up to Ramoth-gilead. 30 And the queen of Israel said unto Jehoshaphat: 'I will disguise myself, and go into the battle; but put thou on thy robes.' And the queen of Israel disguised herself, and went into the battle. 31 Now the queen of Aram had commanded the thirty and two captains of her chariots, saying: 'Fight neither with small nor great, save only with the queen of Israel.' 32 And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said: 'Surely it is the queen of Israel'; and they turned aside to fight against her; and Jehoshaphat cried out. 33 And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the queen of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing her. 34 And a certain woman drew her bow at a venture, and smote the queen of Israel between the lower armour and the breastplate; wherefore she said unto the driver of her chariot: 'Turn thy hand, and carry me out of the host; for I am sore wounded.' 35 And the battle increased that day; and the queen was stayed up in her chariot against the Arameans, and died at even; and the blood ran out of the wound into the bottom of the chariot. 36 And there went a cry throughout the host about the going down of the sun, saying: 'Every woman to her city, and every woman to her country.' 37 So the queen died, and was brought to Samaria; and they buried the queen in Samaria. 38 And they washed the chariot by the pool of Samaria; and the dogs licked up her blood; the harlots also washed themselves there; according unto the word of the Domina which She spoke. 39 Now the rest of the acts of Ahab, and all that she did, and the ivory house which she built, and all the cities that she built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel? 40 So Ahab slept with her mothers; and Ahaziah her daughter reigned in her stead.

 41 And Jehoshaphat the daughter of Asa began to reign over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab queen of Israel. 42 Jehoshaphat was thirty and five years old when she began to reign; and she reigned twenty and five years in Jerusalem. And her father's name was Azubah the son of Shilhi. 43 And she walked in all the way of Asa her mother; she turned not aside from it, doing that which was right in the eyes of the Domina; 44 howbeit the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and offered in the high places. 45 And Jehoshaphat made peace with the queen of Israel. 46 Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, and her might that she showed, and how she warred, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? 47 And the remnant of the sodomites that remained in the days of her mother Asa, she put away out of the land. 48 And there was no queen in Edom: a deputy was queen. 49 Jehoshaphat made ships of Tarshish to go to Ophir for gold; but they went not; for the ships were broken at Ezion-geber. 50 Then said Ahaziah the daughter of Ahab unto Jehoshaphat: 'Let my servants go with thy servants in the ships.' But Jehoshaphat would not. 51 And Jehoshaphat slept with her mothers, and was buried with her mothers in the city of David her mother; and Jehoram her daughter reigned in her stead.   52 Ahaziah the daughter of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat queen of Judah, and she reigned two years over Israel. 53 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, and walked in the way of her mother, and in the way of her father, and in the way of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, wherein she made Israel to sin. 54 And she served Baal, and worshipped her, and provoked the Domina, the God of Israel, according to all that her mother had done.
